gw.api.validation

Class ValidationExceptionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.validation.ValidationExceptionUtil

  • public class ValidationExceptionUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods to help with validation exceptions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ValidationExceptionUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void throwDisplayableValidationExceptionIfNecessary(ValidationResult result, ValidationLevel level)
      Throws a DisplayableEntityValidationException if the result object has any errors or warnings at the specified validation level.
      static void throwEntityValidationExceptionIfNecessary(ValidationResult result, ValidationLevel level)
      Throws an EntityValidationException if the result object has any errors or warnings at the specified validation level.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ValidationExceptionUtil

        public ValidationExceptionUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • throwEntityValidationExceptionIfNecessary

        public static void throwEntityValidationExceptionIfNecessary(ValidationResult result,
                                                             ValidationLevel level)
        Throws an EntityValidationException if the result object has any errors or warnings at the specified validation level. This method should be used within the beforeSave and beforeCommit callbacks in the UI to abort the operation and inform the web layer of the validation problems.
        Parameters:
        result - the ValidationResult object to check
        level - the ValidationLevel to check for errors or warnings

      • throwDisplayableValidationExceptionIfNecessary

        public static void throwDisplayableValidationExceptionIfNecessary(ValidationResult result,
                                                                  ValidationLevel level)
        Throws a DisplayableEntityValidationException if the result object has any errors or warnings at the specified validation level. This method should be used within the beforeSave and beforeCommit callbacks in the UI to abort the operation and inform the web layer of the validation problems.
        Parameters:
        result - the ValidationResult object to check
        level - the ValidationLevel to check for errors or warnings
